definition: to make extravagant demands/an unreasonable request
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: Covetousness is that longing that says, "If only".
sentences.chinese: 貪婪是奢求，這種想法會讓你說，“只要。

sentences.english: The family of five has become "deluxe."
sentences.chinese: 五口之家已經是一種奢求。

sentences.english: Not crave forever, because too far.
sentences.chinese: 纈不奢求永遠，因爲太遠。

sentences.english: But we climbers don't have the luxury of purchasing that competitive edge.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們攀巖者無法奢求購得這樣的競爭優勢。

sentences.english: Once had to meet, do not want a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 曾經擁有過就要滿足，不會奢求一輩子。

sentences.english: Everything is just a process and desire, but more luxury.
sentences.chinese: 一切都只是一個過程和願望，不過多奢求。

sentences.english: I want nothing but your kindness to me.
sentences.chinese: 我不奢求太多，只想你對我好點。

sentences.english: You can’t expect things to happen immediately.
sentences.chinese: 你不能奢求事情一下大功告成。

sentences.english: Management is no longer a luxury.
But the poetry of rubbish seems a luxury now.
sentences.chinese: 但關於廢品的詩歌似乎仍屬奢求。

sentences.english: No man can draw the line between necessities and luxuries.
sentences.chinese: 沒人能在奢求與需求之間劃上明顯的界限。

sentences.english: Maybe we can't go back, please do not crave nothing.
sentences.chinese: 也許回不去了，請你不要再奢求什麼了。

sentences.english: Wish not for things, but for wisdom and courage.
sentences.chinese: 不奢求物質，只追求智慧和勇氣。

definition: an extravagant hope/to have excessive expectations
to seek for/to hope to gain/desirous
to long for/to crave for/to greatly desire
content with one's situation/to know contentment (hence happiness)
to fail to live up (to expectations)/unworthy (of trust)/to let down/to betray (hopes)/to disappoint
